description: Ms. codex. Title from colophon on leaf 142b. Physical description: 17 lines per page; written in small nastaʻliq in black on glazed, laid Arabic paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Occasional staining. Origin: 19 Jumādá II, 1047 H [8 November 1637] in Iṣfahān, by ʻAlī ibn Sulṭān Aḥmad (leaf 142b). Incipit: الحمد لله ... وبعد فهذه فوايد علقتها على كتاب شرايع الاسلام
author: Muḥaqqiq al-Thānī, ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥusayn, 1463 or 1464-1533 or 1534
abstract: Commentary on al-Muḥaqqiq al-Ḥillī's Sharāʼiʻ al-Islām.
extent: 142 leaves : paper ; 196 x 127 (135 x 82) mm bound to 203 x 131 mm
title: Ḥāshiyat Sharāʼiʻ al-Islām wa-al-muslimīn.
provenance: Owners' stamps and notes on leaf 1a.
creator: محقق الثاني، علي بن الحسين، 1463 or 1464-1533 or 1534
subject: Muḥaqqiq al-Ḥillī, Jaʻfar ibn al-Ḥasan, 1205 or 1206-1277—Sharāʼiʻ al-Islām.
binding note: Quarter leather with magenta paper over boards.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
